problem: The polynomial $ax^3 + bx - c$ is divisible by $x^2 + bx + c,$ where $a,$ $b,$ and $c$ are nonzero real numbers.  Find $ab.$
solution:
If $ax^3 + bx - c$ has $x^2 + bx + c$ has a factor, then the other factor must be of the form $ax - 1,$ in order to make the leading and constant coefficients match.  Thus,
\[(x^2 + bx + c)(ax - 1) = ax^3 + bx - c.\]Expanding, we get
\[ax^3 + (ab - 1) x^2 + (ac - b) x - c = ax^3 + bx - c.\]Matching coefficients, we get
\begin{align*}
ab - 1 &= 0, \\
ac - b &= b.
\end{align*}Hence, $ab = \boxed{1}.$
